page.title: 01Lumsden & farmland to SW
page.content: Block consists very largely of flattish farmland at average altitude of rather more than 200m above sea level. Along western edge rise heather covered hills, although only the lower slopes are within the block. Along the eastern edge lies the road running south from the village of Lumsden. Of this, which has a total population of about 250, more than half lies within the block. In this southern part of the village are a primary school, a garage (including petrol pumps and repair facilites) a post office which is included in the garage complex, a police station (one policeman) and general shop. The village and farm population is served by a doctor living and holding his surgery in Rhynie,three and a half miels away. There is no industry in the village
